comments:
In this class, important methods, skills, and the apparatus used for the acquisition and interpretation of quantitative information about chemical systems will be discussed in principle and used in the laboratory.

Students enjoyed the class and remarked that this lab gave "sufficient conceptual background to facilitate understanding." They found the "size and structure of the class were very conducive to learning a wide variety of new skills and techniques."

Professor Phillips posts "helpful powerpoints" for lab analysis, although one student explained that more guidance could have been given for lab instructions. Students felt that she "was helpful and enthusiastic."

Students found the lab reports "extremely lengthy," and the expectations/grading were unclear. But for the most part, the class wasn't "too stressful.”

*This review was based on less than 8 comments
